alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Malibu Coast; Palos Verdes Hills; Santa Clarita Valley; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 4:53AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...much of Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain and excessive runoff may result in dangerous flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding is likely. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful winter storm has brought 2 to 4 inches of rain to most of the watch area. Additional rainfall up to one inch is possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
